title: Steve Spurrier records and numbers
text: Steve Spurrier records and numbers Oct 14 2015 9:29 pm South Carolina head coach Steve Spurrier, center, is carried off the field after the Gamecocks clinched the SEC East title with a win at Florida in 2010. APPhoto/John Raoux × 1987 Duke 5-6 First season as head coach 1988 Duke 7-3-1 Started 5-0 1989 Duke 8-4 ACC champs, lost All-American Bowl 1990 Florida 9-2 No bowl trip because of probation 1991 Florida 10-2 SEC champs, lost Sugar Bowl 1992 Florida 9-4 Won Gator Bowl 1993 Florida 11-2 SEC champs, won Sugar Bowl 1994 Florida 10-2-1 SEC champs, lost Sugar Bowl 1995 Florida 12-1 SEC champs, lost Fiesta Bowl 1996 Florida 12-1 Won SEC/Sugar Bowl/national title 1997 Florida 10-2 Won Citrus Bowl 1998 Florida 10-2 Won Orange Bowl 1999 Florida 9-4 Lost Citrus Bowl 2000 Florida 10-3 SEC champs, lost Sugar Bowl 2001 Florida 10-2 Won Orange Bowl 2005 USC 7-5 Lost Independence Bowl 2006 USC 8-5 Won Liberty Bowl 2007 USC 6-6 Lost last five games 2008 USC 7-6 Lost Outback Bowl 2009 USC 7-6 Lost Papajohns.com Bowl 2010 USC 9-5 Won SEC East, lost Chick-fil-A Bowl 2011 USC 11-2 Won Capital One Bowl 2012 USC 11-2 Won Outback Bowl 2013 USC 11-2 Won Capital One Bowl 2014 USC 7-6 Won Independence Bowl 2015 USC 2-4 Resigned halfway through season Duke total: 20-13-1 1983 Tampa Bay 11-7 None 1984 Tampa Bay 14-5 0-1 1985 Tampa Bay 10-9 0-1 USFL total: 35-21 April 20, 1945: Born in Miami 1966: Wins Heisman Trophy as Florida Gators quarterback 1967: 1st-round NFL draft pick, San Francisco 49ers 1978: Named quarterbacks coach at Florida 1979: Named quarterbacks coach at Duke 1982: Named head coach of USFL’s Tampa Bay Bandits 1986: Named head coach at Duke for 1987 season 1989: Wins ACC championship at Duke 1989: Named head coach at Florida for 1990 season 1991: Wins first of six SEC titles at Florida Jan. 2, 1997: Wins national championship at Florida Jan. 4, 2002 – Resigned as Florida head coach Jan. 14, 2002 – Named head coach of Washington Redskins Nov. 23, 2004 – Named head coach at South Carolina Oct. 29, 2005 – Gamecocks get first-ever win at Tennessee Nov. 12, 2005 – USC’s first win over Florida since 1930 Jan. 2, 2010 – First coach to lead USC to four bowl games Oct. 9, 2010 – Defeats No. 1-ranked Alabama Nov. 13, 2010 – Win at Florida clinches SEC East title Nov. 24, 2012 – Beats Clemson to become the winningest coach in South Carolina history (65) Nov. 30, 2013 – Fifth straight victory over Clemson Dec. 27, 2014: Defeats Miami in Independence Bowl for Gamecocks’ fourth straight bowl win Oct. 10, 2015: Loses at LSU to fall to 2-4 overall, 0-4 in SEC Oct. 13, 2015: Officially announces resignation as South Carolina head coach Wins by a coach at SEC schools Coach Schools Wins 1. Bear Bryant Kentucky/Alabama 292 2. Steve Spurrier Florida/USC 208 3. Vince Dooley Georgia 201 4. Dan McGugin Vanderbilt 197 5. John Vaught Ole Miss 190 6. Shug Jordan Auburn 176 7. Robert Neyland Tennessee 173 8. Phil Fulmer Tennessee 152 9. Mark Richt Georgia 140 9. Wallace Butts Georgia 140 South Carolina coaching wins
